title: Nvidia Stock, Other Magnificent Seven Quite Uneven So Far This Year
text:
BREAKING: Core PCE Inflation In Line With Views     Not all Magnificent Seven stocks were created equal. The Magnificent Seven gave investors a great rally in 2023, accounting for most of the S&P 500's gains. But their gains turned out to be more uneven than in the prior year, with a couple even entering negative territory on an annual basis. In total, the seven stocks contributed a 53% gain to the S&P 500 through the year ended Feb. 6, 2023, according to Adam Turnquist, chief technical strategist for LPL Financial. For the year ended Feb. 5, 2024, that increased to 59.7%. The contributions of the seven stocks has been uneven. For the year ended Feb. 6, 2023, Apple (AAPL) contributed 14.3% while the other six contributed an average of 6.4%. Microsoft (MSFT) contributed the least at 5.2% while Alphabet (GOOGLE) contributed the most with 7.3%. But that changed in the 52 weeks that ended on Monday. Nvidia (NVDA) contributed the most with 32.8%, up from just 6.4% in the prior year, while Tesla (TSLA) actually weighed the index down by 12.6%. In the prior year, it contributed 7%.  Meta (META) was a distant second and helped the S&P 500 gain 15.6% followed closely by Microsoft's (MSFT) 14.8%. Much of Meta's gains this year came after it reported its results for the quarter ended December on Thursday. Shares surged 20% the next day and added $204.5 billion to Meta's market cap at the close of the trading, per Dow Jones Market Data and FactSet. Meanwhile, Amazon.com (AMZN) gave a 11% boost to the S&P 500 for the year ended Feb. 5, thanks to an 8% gain after quarterly results were announced Thursday. On the other hand, Apple's contribution was a negative 4.8%. Alphabet's contribution shrank from 7.3% to 3%.
